page.title: 02Inland Water - Rivers
page.content: The River Walkham, rising on the west side of Dartmoor below Cut Hill forms a wide valley which runs southerly for the greater part of its length. It is fast flowing,boulder strewn, with steep sides to the valley floor and trees growing to the water's edge. There are many streams running into the river and some ground is boggy. After snow and heavy rain it tends to flood. This area is very beautiful, unpolluted and undeveloped. There is good variety for wild life, being a major spawning ground for salmon and migratory trout. LEATS or open conduits for water are a feature, in some cases stillsupplying water for farms. Just north of Feather Tor is an example of a "bull's-eye", where one leat is diverted into three directions.
